= Nexus =
Implements standard maven HTTP "protocol" but also add some REST based search and stuff like that.
See: * http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/nexus-indexer-lucene-plugin/default/docs/index.html * http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/nexus-indexer-lucene-plugin/default/docs/rest.lucene.search.html * http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/nexus-core-documentation-plugin/core/docs/index.html * http://search.maven.org/#search%7Cgav%7C1%7Cg%3A%22org.sonatype.nexus%22%20AND%20a%3A%22nexus-rest-client-java%22
= Ivy =
http://ant.apache.org/ivy/
Should not be too hard since they provide all the needed Java tools to deal with Ivy repositories.
= bintray =
https://bintray.com
Some kind of Nexus from extension connector point of view.
= Pypi =
http://pypi.python.org/pypi
The idea is to allow to easily install a python package to be used in ~{{python}} macro and any module using Jython (like the ~{{code}} macro for example).
See http://sourceforge.net/projects/mavenjython/ for how to access Pypi in Java.
= Debian repositories format =
Why not ? It does not have to contains only linux bins.
= Ruby Gems =
Things like [[Raven>>http://raven.rubyforge.org/]] are putting java jars in theses repositories.
